Adjust the dollar amount for this node.

The sum of the dollar amounts of all the nodes.\n\n If this number is greater than or equal to the genus, then the puzzle is solvable. There are some situations where the puzzle is solvable even though the count is less than the genus—good luck finding them!

The genus is the number of holes or loops in the puzzle. As you add more loops the number of connections increase, making the puzzle more difficult to solve.

 A good rule of thumb: the puzzle will always be solvable if the count is greater or equal to the genus.

 However the opposite is not the case; there are some puzzles that have a count less than the genus but are still solvable. I hope you have fun finding them!
